features.readyToCalculateTitle: Ready to Calculate Your Microsoft Fabric MVP?
features.readyToCalculateSubtitle: Join thousands of professionals who've used our calculator to plan, present, and execute successful Microsoft Fabric projects

step1.title: Project Goals & Business Objectives
step1.businessGoalPlaceholder: Define what the MVP aims to accomplish (real-time analytics, AI-driven forecasting, cost reduction, revenue optimization, operational efficiency...)
step1.projectScopePlaceholder: Detail specific functionalities required: dashboard creation, automated workflows, predictive analytics, real-time data ingestion, reporting systems, data pipeline automation...
step1.expectedOutcomePlaceholder: Specify quantifiable results: 20% cost reduction, improved customer insights, 15% sales forecasting accuracy, faster decision-making, ROI targets...

step2.title: Data Sources & Requirements
step2.dataLakesDesc: Azure Data Lake, Blob Storage, ADLS
step2.streamingDataDesc: Kafka, Event Hub, IoT, Real-time feeds
step2.specificSourcesPlaceholder: Describe any specific data sources, connection requirements, or integration challenges...

step4.title: Advanced Analytics Requirements
step4.analyticalOutputsPlaceholder: Describe expected outputs: reports, dashboards, alerts, APIs...
step4.reportingRequirementsPlaceholder: Specify reporting needs: frequency, format, audience...

step5.title: Compute & Processing Requirements
step5.computeNeedsPlaceholder: Describe processing power, memory, storage requirements...
step5.scalabilityExpectationsPlaceholder: Expected growth in data volume, users, processing...

step6.title: Infrastructure & Environment
step6.geographicalRegionsPlaceholder: Specify regions where data and users are located...
step6.complianceRequirementsPlaceholder: GDPR, HIPAA, SOX, PCI-DSS, industry-specific regulations...
step6.securityStandardsPlaceholder: ISO 27001, SOC 2, FedRAMP, custom security requirements...

step7.title: User Access & Security
step7.auditLoggingPlaceholder: Specify what user actions and system events need to be logged...

step8.title: Service Level Requirements
step8.trainingNeedsPlaceholder: User training, admin training, technical documentation...

step10.title: Scalability & Future Expansion
step10.growthProjectionsPlaceholder: Expected growth in users, data volume, processing needs over 1-3 years...
step10.futureExpansionPlaceholder: Additional regions, business units, use cases to be added...
step10.futureFeaturesPlaceholder: Planned features, integrations, or capabilities for future phases...

step11.title: Sustainability & ESG
step11.sustainabilityGoalsPlaceholder: Carbon footprint reduction, green computing, energy efficiency targets...
step11.ethicalDataUsePlaceholder: Data privacy, ethical AI, responsible data handling practices...

step12.title: Vendor Selection Criteria
step12.vendorQualificationsPlaceholder: Microsoft certifications, industry experience, team size, geographic location...
step12.evaluationCriteriaPlaceholder: Technical capability, cost, timeline, support quality, references...

step13.title: Integration & Compatibility
step13.thirdPartyIntegrationsPlaceholder: External APIs, SaaS platforms, legacy systems to integrate...
step13.internalSystemsPlaceholder: Existing databases, applications, infrastructure to maintain compatibility...

step14.title: Timeline & Milestones
step14.projectPhasesPlaceholder: Break down project into phases with key milestones and deliverables...

step15.title: Budget & Cost Expectations
step15.costOptimizationPlaceholder: Areas where cost savings are prioritized, budget constraints, payment preferences...

step17.title: Enterprise-Ready Specifications Complete!
step17.subtitle: Comprehensive Microsoft Fabric MVP requirements & investment analysis ready

partnerSetup.bioPLaceholder: Describe your expertise, experience, and what makes you unique...
partnerSetup.keywordsPlaceholder: Enter keywords separated by commas (e.g., Power BI, Data Warehouse, Real-time Analytics)
partnerSetup.caseStudiesPlaceholder: Describe your notable projects, case studies, and success stories. Include specific outcomes and technologies used...
partnerSetup.portfolioLinksPlaceholder: Add links to your portfolio, case studies, or project examples (one per line)...

partnerSetup.premiumPaymentInstructions: Premium partners will receive payment instructions

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: From MVP requirements to implementation partner selection - streamline your Microsoft Fabric project planning in 6 simple steps
howItWorks.save80PlanningDesc: Skip weeks of requirements gathering with our structured approach
howItWorks.accurateCostEstimatesDesc: Get realistic budgets based on 1000+ real MVP projects
howItWorks.qualifiedPartnersOnlyDesc: Connect with verified Microsoft Fabric specialists
howItWorks.professionalDocumentationDesc: Investor-ready pitch decks and technical specifications
howItWorks.defineRequirementsDesc: Use our comprehensive 16-step calculator to specify your Microsoft Fabric MVP needs, from data sources to analytics capabilities.
howItWorks.getInstantCostEstimatesDesc: Receive detailed pricing breakdown for infrastructure, development, and ongoing support based on your specific requirements.
howItWorks.generateProfessionalDocumentationDesc: Download a complete PDF pitch deck with all specifications, cost breakdowns, and project requirements.
howItWorks.findImplementationPartnersDesc: Browse our verified partner directory and select qualified consultants, freelancers, or solution providers.
howItWorks.sendAutomatedOutreachDesc: Use our pre-written email templates to contact selected partners with your complete project specifications.
howItWorks.startMvpDevelopmentDesc: Begin development with clear specifications, qualified partners, and realistic timelines and budgets.
howItWorks.seeCompleteProcess: See the complete process in action - from requirements to partner selection
howItWorks.3MinuteOverview: 3-minute overview of the complete Microsoft Fabric MVP planning process
howItWorks.howAccurateEstimates: How accurate are the cost estimates?
howItWorks.estimatesBasedOn1000: Our estimates are based on 1000+ real Microsoft Fabric implementations and updated monthly with current Azure pricing.
howItWorks.allPartnersVerified: Yes, all partners go through a verification process including Microsoft certifications, portfolio review, and reference checks.
howItWorks.canModifySpecs: Can I modify the generated specifications?
howItWorks.specsStartingPoint: Absolutely! The PDF specifications serve as a starting point. You can edit and customize them for your specific needs.
howItWorks.costToUseCalculator: Is there a cost to use the calculator?
howItWorks.calculatorBasicFree: The calculator and basic features are completely free. Partners pay for premium directory placement and enhanced features.
howItWorks.needHelpRequirements: What if I need help with the requirements?
howItWorks.partnerNetworkHelp: Our partner network includes consultants who specialize in requirements analysis and can help refine your MVP scope.
howItWorks.trackPartnerResponses: How do I track partner responses?
howItWorks.partnersRespondDirectly: Partners respond directly to your email. We also provide optional lead tracking for premium users.
howItWorks.readyToStart: Ready to Start Your Microsoft Fabric MVP?
howItWorks.joinThousands: Join thousands of professionals who've used our platform to successfully plan and implement their Microsoft Fabric projects
